wexpman.hookobjects.impl

Class ExperimentHookBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • wexpman.hookobjects.impl.ExperimentHookBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ExperimentHook
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StopAtFirstProcessingHook

    public abstract class ExperimentHookBehavior
extends Object
implements ExperimentHook
    A custom container of code that can be executed at specific points in the lifecycle of the application Base class for all hooks The base implementation uses locks to ensure that hooks on the same element will not run concurrently, any other concurrency, synchronization or communication features must be provided by the concrete implementation
    Author:
    Matias Alberto Gavinowich

      protected ExperimentHookBehavior()
      Constructs the hook Concrete implementations must provide a default (no arguments) constructor or no constructor at all
